meanings.definition: Witherods: plural noun - slender, flexible rods used for tying up plants in a garden
meanings.sent1: I used the witherods to support the tomato plants in my garden.
meanings.sent2: The gardener reached for the witherods to secure the climbing roses.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the witherods for a fun obstacle course.
meanings.sent4: Her hair cascaded down her back like a cascade of witherods.
meanings.sent5: The witherods swayed gently in the breeze, a dance of support for the flowers.

meanings.definition: Witherods: verb - to dry up or shrivel due to lack of moisture
meanings.sent1: The leaves began to witherods under the scorching sun.
meanings.sent2: Without water, the flowers will witherods and die.
meanings.sent3: The forgotten fruit in the fridge started to witherods into raisins.
meanings.sent4: Her hopes seemed to witherods as the deadline approached.
meanings.sent5: The once vibrant garden began to witherods, a silent plea for rain.

meanings.definition: Witherods: adjective - describing something that is dried up or shriveled
meanings.sent1: The witherods leaves crunched underfoot in the autumn forest.
meanings.sent2: The witherods flowers looked forlorn in the neglected garden.
meanings.sent3: The witherods fruit in the bowl had seen better days.
meanings.sent4: His witherods skin showed the harsh effects of the desert sun.
meanings.sent5: The witherods tree stood stark against the winter sky, a ghost of its former self.
